alert.note: Alert for Hartford; Tolland (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 12:27PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Showers and thunderstorms with heavy rain in eastern Hartford and western Tolland Counties moving northward into Hampden County... At 1222 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Vernon, moving north at 25 mph. It was embedded within a larger area of showers and thunderstorms. Torrential downpours, with up to 1 to 2 inches of rain in an hour, were occurring with the heaviest thunderstorms. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Hartford, West Hartford, Manchester, Chicopee, East Hartford, Enfield, Westfield, Holyoke, Glastonbury, Newington, Vernon, Windsor, Agawam, West Springfield, Wethersfield, Mansfield, South Windsor, Ludlow and Bloomfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
